text: some people are afraid to win some
people are afraid to lose I was probably
the latter of that I was afraid I was
going to lose and it made me play harder
and and made my desire to win even
greater golfer Arnold Palmer was one of
the most celebrated and charismatic
athletes of the 20th century nicknamed
the king for his domination of the sport
in the late 1950s and early 1960s he won
95 professional golf trends launched a
prosperous golf course design company
and created cable television's golf
channel late in life he found new
popularity when he devised the drink
combination lemonade and iced tea the
Arnold Palmer
Arnold Daniel Palmer was born in
September 10th 1929 raised in western
Pennsylvania in the small blue-collar
town of Latrobe Arnold's roots in golf
were working-class he learned the game
from his father who was the
groundskeeper and later the head
professional at the Latrobe Country Club
his first job was cleaning and repairing
clubs for the Latrobe members it made
people aware that wasn't just people
that worked in a office building and
made lots of money that golf was for
them it was for everyone and and of
course that caught on and caught on very
rapidly the 1954 United States amateur
victory led to a series of professional
wins and by 1958 he won the Masters the
first of his seven major championship
titles but it was the way Palmer one
with a swashbuckling style that
energized golf and drew millions of new
fans to the game behind Palmer's public
risk-taking personality was a desire for
perfection he spent countless hours
tinkering with his club I always felt
that if I had the club that absolutely
was perfect and looking down at it that
I should play perfect golf and that was
my goal
